creator: markus.hager@bluebull.com
text:
The format of Date and Number doesn't work correctly.
It remembers the first locale and use this for the formatting.
With 4.0.6 it works very fine.
If this is not a bug of tomcat I am sorry.
What format of date and number ? Please give a test case.
creator: remm@apache.org
markus.hager@bluebull.com
text:
If you try the example of the jakata i18n taglibs (format.jsp) you will see the
different formats of the userLocale, the US Locale,....

I you take a look on the format of Numbers(not currency or percent) and Date(
but not DateTime) then you will see that there is no difference.
I have request the site with my en_US locale in mozilla. then i tried to get a
new session with the Konquerer Browser of KDE but with the locale de_DE. The
format was the same like the US.

With tomcat 4.0.6 ist works fine. There the different formats displayed on the
single side and if you change the locale on the index.jsp the format changes.

This looks related to Bug #14695
http://nagoya.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=14695
which has been fixed in Standard 1.0.2.

Did you try disabling Tag-pooling to verify the behaviour ?

text:
I think the explanation is: when you disable tag pooling, you have to cleanup
your work directory to get new source generated.
If disabling tag pooling fixed the problems, then the tags are not compliant
with the specification.
